subject: Science

key_concepts.chemical_reaction: A process in which one or more substances react to form new substances with different properties
key_concepts.chemical_equation: A symbolic representation of a chemical reaction using chemical formulas

types_of_chemical_reactions.definition: Two or more substances combine to form a single product
A single compound breaks down into two or more simpler substances
A more reactive element displaces a less reactive element from its compound
Exchange of ions between two compounds

oxidation_and_reduction.oxidation: Gain of oxygen or loss of hydrogen
oxidation_and_reduction.reduction: Loss of oxygen or gain of hydrogen
oxidation_and_reduction.redox_reaction: A reaction in which oxidation and reduction occur simultaneously

corrosion.definition: Slow destruction of metals by chemical reactions with the environment

rancidity.definition: Oxidation of fats and oils that leads to unpleasant smell and taste

one_liner: No reaction is one-sided—oxidation and reduction always move together.

subject: Science

key_concepts.acid: A substance that produces hydrogen ions (H+) in aqueous solution
key_concepts.base: A substance that produces hydroxide ions (OH−) in aqueous solution
key_concepts.salt: A compound formed by the neutralisation of an acid and a base

chemical_properties.reaction_with_metals: Acids react with metals to produce hydrogen gas
chemical_properties.reaction_with_metal_carbonates: Acids react with metal carbonates to form salt, water, and carbon dioxide
chemical_properties.neutralisation: Reaction between an acid and a base to form salt and water

one_liner: pH decides personality—of solutions and exam questions alike.

subject: Science

key_concepts.metal: Elements that are generally hard, shiny, malleable, ductile and good conductors of heat and electricity
key_concepts.non_metal: Elements that lack metallic properties and are generally poor conductors

chemical_properties.reaction_with_oxygen: Metals form basic oxides, non-metals form acidic oxides
chemical_properties.reaction_with_water: Reactive metals react vigorously with water
chemical_properties.reaction_with_acids: Metals react with acids to produce hydrogen gas

reactivity_series.description: Arrangement of metals in decreasing order of reactivity

corrosion.definition: Gradual destruction of metals by chemical reactions

one_liner: Reactivity decides everything—from extraction to corrosion.

subject: Science

key_concepts.carbon: An element known for forming a large number of compounds due to catenation
key_concepts.covalent_bond: A bond formed by sharing of electrons

homologous_series.definition: A series of organic compounds with similar chemical properties

one_liner: Carbon’s bonding ability is the backbone of life and chemistry.

subject: Science

key_concepts.life_processes: Basic functions performed by living organisms to maintain life
key_concepts.nutrition: Process of obtaining and utilising food

heterotrophic.definition: Organisms depend on others for food

one_liner: Life runs on systems—miss one, everything slows down.

subject: Science

key_concepts.control_and_coordination: Regulation of body activities in response to stimuli
key_concepts.stimulus: Any change in environment that causes a response

endocrine_system.definition: System of glands that secrete hormones

feedback_mechanism.definition: Regulation of hormone secretion to maintain balance

one_liner: Control systems keep life stable—without them, chaos wins.

key_concepts.reproduction: Biological process by which new individuals of the same species are produced

sexual_reproduction_in_humans.fertilisation: Fusion of male and female gametes

key_concepts.heredity: Transmission of traits from parents to offspring
key_concepts.variation: Differences among individuals of the same species

mendel_experiments.monohybrid_cross: Cross involving one pair of contrasting traits
mendel_experiments.dihybrid_cross: Cross involving two pairs of contrasting traits

evolution.definition: Gradual change in organisms over generations

subject: Science

key_concepts.source_of_energy: Anything that can be used to produce heat, light, or power

thermal_power_plant.process: Heat energy → Mechanical energy → Electrical energy

one_liner: Energy choice today decides environment tomorrow.

subject: Science

key_concepts.light: A form of energy that enables us to see objects
key_concepts.reflection: Bouncing back of light from a surface
key_concepts.refraction: Bending of light when it passes from one medium to another

laws_of_reflection: Angle of incidence equals angle of reflection
Incident ray, reflected ray and normal lie in the same plane
one_liner: Light follows rules—break them and the diagram breaks you.

subject: Science
chapter_name: The Human Eye and the Colourful World

key_concepts.human_eye: A natural optical instrument that enables vision
key_concepts.retina: Light-sensitive screen inside the eye where image is formed

structure_of_human_eye.cornea: Transparent front part that refracts light
structure_of_human_eye.iris: Controls the size of the pupil
structure_of_human_eye.pupil: Regulates the amount of light entering the eye
structure_of_human_eye.optic_nerve: Carries visual signals to the brain

dispersion_of_light.definition: Splitting of white light into its constituent colours

atmospheric_phenomena: Red colour of sunrise and sunset
one_liner: Vision is physics meeting biology—with zero margin for error.

subject: Science

key_concepts.electric_current: Rate of flow of electric charge

resistance.definition: Opposition to the flow of current

one_liner: Electricity is formulas plus discipline—mess up units and marks vanish.

subject: Science

key_concepts.electric_current: Rate of flow of electric charge

resistance.definition: Opposition to the flow of current

one_liner: Electricity is formulas plus discipline—mess up units and marks vanish.

subject: Science

key_concepts.ecosystem: A system formed by interaction of living organisms with their physical environment
key_concepts.food_chain: A sequence of organisms through which energy is transferred

energy_flow.ten_percent_law: Only 10% of energy is transferred from one trophic level to the next

food_web.definition: A network of interconnected food chains

environmental_issues.biomagnification: Increase in concentration of toxic substances at higher trophic levels
environmental_issues.ozone_depletion: Reduction of ozone layer due to CFCs

one_liner: Nature runs on balance—break it, and everything pays.

subject: Science

key_concepts.natural_resources: Resources obtained from nature that are essential for human survival
key_concepts.sustainable_development: Development that meets present needs without compromising future generations

one_liner: Resources are borrowed, not owned—management decides survival.
